intro: Simsia ghiesbreghtii, commonly known as the Ghiesbreght's simsia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, thriving in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Its foliage is usually hairy, and it produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring. Simsia ghiesbreghtii is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its alpine habitat.
